text.div:
Generated Narrative: CodeSystem space-exercise-modality-cs

This case-sensitive code system http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/aerospace/CodeSystem/space-exercise-modality-cs defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
treadmill Treadmill running in microgravityRunning or walking on a vibration-isolated treadmill with harness-based body-weight simulation.
cycle-ergometer Cycle ergometer (CEVIS or equivalent)Seated or supine cycling on a vibration-isolated ergometer with adjustable resistance.
ared-resistive ARED resistive exerciseHeavy-load resistive exercise using a flywheel or vacuum-based Advanced Resistive Exercise Device.
resistive-squat Resistive squatsSquat movements using ARED or equivalent resistive hardware.
resistive-deadlift Resistive deadliftsDeadlift movements using ARED or equivalent resistive hardware.
resistive-calfraise Resistive calf raisesCalf-raise movements using ARED or equivalent resistive hardware.
ag-centrifuge Artificial gravity centrifuge exerciseExercise performed in a short-radius or long-radius centrifuge providing partial or full gravity.
elastic-band Elastic band exercisePortable elastic-band or bungee-based resistive training.
body-weight-sim Body-weight simulation harnessExercise performed with harness-based body-weight simulation, typically on a treadmill.

name: SpaceExerciseModalityCS
title: Space Exercise Modality Code System
description: Spaceflight-specific exercise modalities used in microgravity and partial gravity environments (e.g., ISS treadmill, ARED resistive training, artificial gravity).

concept.definition: Running or walking on a vibration-isolated treadmill with harness-based body-weight simulation.
Seated or supine cycling on a vibration-isolated ergometer with adjustable resistance.
Heavy-load resistive exercise using a flywheel or vacuum-based Advanced Resistive Exercise Device.
Squat movements using ARED or equivalent resistive hardware.
Deadlift movements using ARED or equivalent resistive hardware.
Calf-raise movements using ARED or equivalent resistive hardware.
Exercise performed in a short-radius or long-radius centrifuge providing partial or full gravity.
Portable elastic-band or bungee-based resistive training.
Exercise performed with harness-based body-weight simulation, typically on a treadmill.
